definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
(classical particle similar to 於|于[yu2]) in/at/from/because/than/(classical final particle similar to 嗎|吗[ma5], 吧[ba5], 呢[ne5], expressing question, doubt or astonishment)
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

sentences.english: They surprised us with a visit.
sentences.chinese: 他们出乎意外地访问了我们。
出乎意外的是，没有人怀疑。

sentences.english: Quite accidentally, the police tumbled on the answer to the mystery.
sentences.chinese: 警察出乎意外地找到了那疑案的答案。

sentences.english: And suddenly he smiled a quite unexpected smile of fatherly kindliness .
sentences.chinese: 于是他忽然出乎意外地流露出父亲般温柔的微笑。

sentences.english: Many big shots are arrogant but some are surprisingly humble.
sentences.chinese: 许多大人物很骄傲，有些则出乎意外的谦虚。
他的启程是出乎意外的。

sentences.english: Quite accidently the answer to the mystery came tumbling into the police's lap.
sentences.chinese: 真出乎意外，警察偶然找到了那疑案的答案。

sentences.english: This news had smashed all his hopes like a bolt from the blue.
sentences.chinese: 这一出乎意外的消息使他的全部希望都破灭了。

sentences.english: A brush on canvas can be remarkably soothing.
sentences.chinese: 在画布上的画笔可以出乎意外地使人感到安慰。

sentences.english: The unexpected news knocked me out.
sentences.chinese: 这个出乎意外的消息让我大为吃惊。

sentences.english: Dr Rubenstein said the discovery was totally unexpected.
sentences.chinese: 鲁宾斯坦博士说这次的发现也是完全出乎意外。

sentences.english: My hostess greeted me with unexpected cordiality.
sentences.chinese: 我的女主人以出乎意外的热诚迎接我。

sentences.english: I have already said, this matter is unexpectedly.
sentences.chinese: 我已经说过，这件事是出乎意外的。

definition: turned out other than expected (idiom); unexpected
due to/to stem from/to go beyond (also fig. beyond reason, expectations etc)/to go against (expectations)
to exceed all expectations/to come as a surprise
not expected at the outset (idiom)/unforeseen/to be surprised by the turn of events
to come as no surprise/as expected
